tesla q2 earnings fall short of wall street expectations
tesla (tsla) reported second quarter results that fell short of wall street estimates on both the top and bottom lines. adjusted earnings of $0.40 per share fell short of the bloomberg consensus estimate of $0.42. revenue of $22.50 billion fell short of the expected $22.64 billion. free cash flow was also lower than anticipated. gross margins were higher than expected, though, 17.2% versus an estimate of 16.5%. the company says it began the builds of a more affordable vehicle and plans to start production of its cybercab in 2026. karim bousta, dvx ventures co-founder and managing director as well as a former tesla vp, joins asking for a trend to discuss the results. to watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more asking for a trend here.
